arts.ttl: Paul Mitchell sees £118m flex as Newcastle find 'unique' solution
arts.sum: Mario Lemina gave Wolves the lead from close range before half-time, but superb strikes from Fabian Schar and Harvey Barnes turned the game on its head late on as the Magpies made their best start to a campaign since 1995. Although Alexander Isak's withdrawal was enforced, after the record signing took a whack to the face, Howe also hooked both Joelinton and Sean Longstaff as the Magpies boss threw on £118m of talent in Sandro Tonali, Joe Willock and Harvey Barnes.

arts.ttl: Eddie Howe full of praise for matchwinner Harvey Barnes
'One of the best': Jamie Carragher blown away by one Newcastle player after seeing him live v Wolves
arts.sum: Newcastle picked up a superb comeback win at Wolves today to go third in the Premier League table and continue their fine start. The Magpies...

arts.ttl: Eddie Howe clarifies reasons for hooking Newcastle trio and freak Alexander Isak injury explained
arts.sum: All three Toon players had an impact when coming on in the first half but Howe has also described the "disappointment" of some of his squad when he named a much-changed line-up to the side that beat Tottenham Hotspur. I thought they played really well but the most important thing is the players respond in the right way and the best way is playing the next game is how they perform on the pitch.

arts.ttl: 'I have no doubts that we’re going to pick up some big results'
arts.sum: Although denied their first win of the Premier League season, the head coach feels ‘big results’ will come if his players continue to perform like they did against the Magpies. The supporters will be frustrated at the moment, of course, because we’re in a run where it’s tough for us to win games, but they saw from the group, there was a lot of effort, a lot of quality, good understanding, even after going 2-1 down, we had a good few chances to score again.

arts.ttl: Harvey Barnes finds X factor as ruthless Eddie Howe gives Newcastle United stars half-time blast
arts.sum: Howe did not hesitate to make changes at half-time as Joelinton and Sean Longstaff were hooked at the break with Sandro Tonali and Joe Willock introduced while Isak went off after a bang in the face with Harvey Barnes replacing him. The Magpies took seven minutes to carve open Wolves after Alexander Isak's clever pass picked out Jacob Murphy but Sam Johnstone touched the ball over the bar after the winger attempted to chip him from outside the box.

arts.ttl: 'I didn't know': BBC pundit shocked by just how good one Newcastle player is after seeing him live v Wolves today
arts.sum: Newcastle fought back from behind to win at Wolves today as they picked up a much-needed win away from home. Eddie Howe has been keen...

arts.ttl: What Newcastle’s show-stopping comeback at Wolves says about a divided club
arts.sum: Wolverhampton Wanderers 1-2 Newcastle United: Late goals by Fabian Schar and Harvey Barnes sent Newcastle up to third in the early Premier League table

The home side had taken the lead in the first half through Mario Lemina, after Jorgen Strand Larsen crossed into the box and Joao Gomes left the ball for his midfield partner to tap home. Newcastle continued to dominate, but Wolves proved organised and resolute, with the midfield of Lemina, Joao Gomes and Andre – making his first start for the Old Gold – growing into the game, while Matheus Cunha offered a willing runner.

arts.ttl: Harvey Barnes shows why he can save Newcastle United millions and Fabian Schar back with a bang
arts.sum: And retired England full-back Kieran Trippier helped steady the ship in the second half as Fabian Schar's deflected strike and Barnes' wonder goal earned a big away win. Head coach Eddie Howe shook things up at the break by introducing Harvey Barnes, Sandro Tonali and Joe Willock with the trio of changes making an impact.
